item.title: A bash alias to export a git repository to a zip file
item.description: I’ll keep this short and sweet. This bash alias will allow you to export your git repo’s master branch to a zip file. To use it: Make sure that your work is committed. Make sure you are in the root directory of your project. To make this script work run the following commands: echo alias gitpack=\'git archive --format zip --output download_$(date +%d-%m-%Y-%H.%M).zip master\' >> ~/.bashrc source ~/.bashrc Now just type gitpack and you will get a zip file.
